answers.answer:
Yes, Romania is accepting Ukrainian refugees fleeing the war. Ukrainians fleeing war at home are welcomed to Romania.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp. You can find information regarding entry requirements, asylum procedures, accommodation, financial assistance, and other support services for Ukrainian refugees.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, Romania is accepting Ukrainian refugees fleeing the war. Ukrainians fleeing war at home are welcomed to Romania.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp. You can find information regarding entry requirements, asylum procedures, accommodation, financial assistance, and other support services for Ukrainian refugees. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp

answers.answer:
The official helpline numbers for Ukrainians seeking assistance in Romania are: CNRR ✆ 0040 730 073 170, UNHCR ✆ +40723653651, IOM Romania ✆ 021 210 3050, and National Line against Trafficking in Persons Romania ✆ 0 800 800 678 / +4021.313.31.00.

You can find this detailed information and more by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and looking under the "Help-lines" section.
answers.bResponse:
The official helpline numbers for Ukrainians seeking assistance in Romania are: CNRR ✆ 0040 730 073 170, UNHCR ✆ +40723653651, IOM Romania ✆ 021 210 3050, and National Line against Trafficking in Persons Romania ✆ 0 800 800 678 / +4021.313.31.00.

You can find this detailed information and more by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and looking under the "Help-lines" section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp

answers.answer:
Ukrainian nationals need a valid passport to enter Romania for a stay of up to 90 days. If they do not have any documents, they can enter as an asylum seeker.

To find this information on the webpage, visit `https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp` and look for the section titled 'Documents'.
answers.bResponse:
Ukrainian nationals need a valid passport to enter Romania for a stay of up to 90 days. If they do not have any documents, they can enter as an asylum seeker.

To find this information on the webpage, visit `https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp` and look for the section titled 'Documents'. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp

answers.answer:
Yes, Ukrainian citizens can enter Romania without a valid passport or other documents by entering as an asylum seeker.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the 'Documents' section.

answers.answer:
Ukrainian nationals can use the Halmeu, Sighetu Marmației, Siret, and Isaccea border points to enter Romania from Ukraine. They can also reach Romania through the Republic of Moldova.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the website and look under the section titled "Border points you can use to cross into Romania From Ukraine".
answers.bResponse:
Ukrainian nationals can use the Halmeu, Sighetu Marmației, Siret, and Isaccea border points to enter Romania from Ukraine. They can also reach Romania through the Republic of Moldova.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the website and look under the section titled "Border points you can use to cross into Romania From Ukraine". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp

answers.answer:
Ukrainian citizens with biometric passports do not need a visa to travel to other European Union countries.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and look under the section titled "Traveling to other Member States of the European Union".
answers.bResponse:
Ukrainian citizens with biometric passports do not need a visa to travel to other European Union countries.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and look under the section titled "Traveling to other Member States of the European Union". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp

answers.answer:
All unaccompanied Ukrainian children, regardless of age, can cross the border into Romania. The General Directorates for Social Assistance and Child Protection (DGASPC) in each county are the authorized institutions responsible for their care.

To find more detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and look under the section titled "Minors entering Romania".

answers.answer:
The General Directorates for Social Assistance and Child Protection (DGASPC) from each county are the institutions authorized to take care of unaccompanied Ukrainian minors in Romania.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the website and read under the section titled "Minors entering Romania".

answers.answer:
To report suspected child abuse cases involving Ukrainian children in Romania, you should call 119, which is a unique national telephone number for child abuse cases.

To find this information on the website, go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp` and look under the section titled "Minors entering Romania".

answers.answer:
Yes, support is available for finding temporary accommodation for Ukrainian refugees in Romania through "Un Acoperis".

To find detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read under the "Accommodation" section.

answers.answer:
Yes, Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) can be exchanged for Romanian lei (RON) at BCR (Romanian Commercial Bank) branches in Romania, up to 2,000 lei per person/Ukrainian passport at the BNR exchange rate. This offer is valid only for individuals with Ukrainian passports.

To find this detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and look under the "Money" section.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) can be exchanged for Romanian lei (RON) at BCR (Romanian Commercial Bank) branches in Romania, up to 2,000 lei per person/Ukrainian passport at the BNR exchange rate. This offer is valid only for individuals with Ukrainian passports.

To find this detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and look under the "Money" section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp

answers.answer:
Ukrainian citizens can open and administer a current account at BCR (Romanian Commercial Bank) with no commission, and there are no fees for transactions made at POS and ATM with cards issued in Ukraine, or for inter and intra bank payments.

You can find this detailed information on the `dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp` website under the 'Money' section.

You can find this detailed information on the `dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp` website under the 'Money' section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp

To find this information on the webpage, navigate to https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and look for the section titled "Emergency help."

The Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers in Romania are located in Rădăuți, Maramureș (Satu Mare), Galați, București, Timișoara, and Giurgiu.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and scroll down to the section titled "Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers."
